rGV9o0mYZaMzIuDqB-GrnA.text: Service is absolutely horrible. Chips and salsa takes 20 minutes to arrive to our table and glasses of water took a good 10 minutes. Absolutely ridiculous.

g1FMS55UIKaKbtb9-8XCfQ.text: Dos Gringos a nice play to go to get some drinks and happy hour. The food is good, but it's nothing that will stand out to you. They have a nice atmosphere and everyone is really friendly. TVs are everywhere and the patio is very nice especially at the right time of the year.

dKGM6qzb6STv_TYpTvbgxA.text: This is the first time I went to this restaurant and it was the worse experience. I would ever go back NO. I order some taco and a corona. the server brought the corona first and I had it. the server recommended some taco and I order. they brought some chips and salsa. I sat had one or two chips. then the tacos came. I went to take the salsa to put on my tacos with my fork and the longest piece or hair was in the salsa. I immediately was sick to my stomach. I just have a thing when it come to hair. so the server ask if she can make me some fresh taco. after you find hair in your food. I don't want an thing else.  so she bring the bill and knock off half the food. when I did not eat ANY of the off. all yall who eat from here better check the salsa. I wont be going back and this was just on Friday.

-f-lkK-VOWdIsQyrNtXtjA.text: Not much needs to be said about a bar devoted to being besotted.  The various signs with catch phrases and college colloquialisms attest to this.  "I like your pants. Especially on my floor," says it all.    Perhaps a devoted patron of this bar would respond with " Don't take life too seriously, you're not going to make it out alive," another turn of phrase that can be found mounted with Rocky Point pride in this establishment.  The atmosphere is meant to be very casual, laid back - like you were spending your spring break in Puerto Penasco.  But the similarities end there.  Quite possibly home of the worst house margarita - so full of the synthetic and syrupy sweet and sour mix that there is nothing more discernible.  Despite there being a full bar, the bartenders have little knowledge of cocktail recipes - I would recommend ordering beer by the bottle.  Although a full menu is available, there is no better word to describe the food than...bad.  If you have ever had a bonafide street taco in Mexico, then you will be dismally disappointed by their poor imitation.  One would assume that it is quite difficult to mess up a taco, but here they got everything wrong in both the preparation of the meat and the salsa that shamefully tried to mask the poor taste of the meat.    There is no need to dissect the menu or its gustatory offerings any further, as Dos is quite frankly a place to play beer pong and get wasted.  It does offer a variety of entertainments such as Tuesday comedy nights and Wednesday's Texas hold 'em.  Bean bag tournaments are also held here.  Dos certainly caters to a specific crowd, I am not one of those that feel as though they still want to be on spring break.

0XCGL_pBSYgY_9NfsjYQXg.text: Teenie Tiny tacos but very tasty.  Green tomatilio salsa was delicious.  Drinks were very refreshing and our waitress Baronica was awesome.

utREzn_R98J-xfifxrACbg.text: Oh, good old Dos Gringos.  I make it a point to hit up this place whenever I'm in Tempe.  The food is cheap, delicious, and there's an excellent patio that is awesome to sit on year-round.  The service can slack a bit when they're busy, but the wait staff seem to always make up for it.  The salsa is delicious, not too spicy, and extremely flavorful.  I've never had a complaint about their food and the drinks are on-point.  The outdoor patio is also dog friendly, which is really awesome.  And there are huge Jenga pieces and a bag toss game which is popular with the kids I've seen there.  I honestly don't know why this place only has three stars...give them a try.

YpEUOYpt-WLf3apZEQujyQ.text: For a place like this the bar is low but they came in even lower than that obnoxious drunk fools and a server who does not give a sh@t I had to go get her for food and drinks I'm out on this

nByiIRnFoegXK2vaYy88-w.text: Bartender skipped through my song on the juke box because it was country. So rude!!!  We are paying customers and if you're going to offer touch tunes music you'd better be able to handle anything the customers will play.

umD6gq8B7MFPwnn-4vFudQ.text: Damn good food, great service! A bit warm though, but I can take it. I recommend this place. My wife says it's like a Mexican food Hooters.

_Jka8Q96aHcS0u51F-UBFA.text: Not a good place to go, food was poorly made, no seasonings, no flavor! Never got our drinks refilled!  Will not go back!

LX7VfsBEYFBWVjLUTJFmXA.text: My review here is based solely on happy hour because I have never really been at any other time. This bar is really close to my work so we frequent it for the after work to wind down from time to time.  I always have a really great time. I like the outdoor seating when the weather is nice, I like that they serve black beans on most of their items rather than refried, I like the cheap buckets of Pacifico during happy hour and I love that they have corn hole or bags or whatever other term people refer to it as.   The table service is always really great and the waitresses have always been friendly, I've never had a poor experience with the staff. Some of the people that go there are pretty big D Bags which is annoying, but since I'm usually with a group of co-workers, I really don't mind.  All in all, this isn't where I'd choose to hang out on a Friday or Saturday night, but I will definitely continue to stop in for happy hour on those days after work when I could really just use a drink!

guDOi7jnrZu2A03bDHo70Q.text: Five of us ate there, None of us enjoyed the food.  Too bad, has fun outside games to play.  Would be nice to go for drinks and play games.

wi3sjWbuf8Htu8TXX9ko5g.text: They call this a bar? I think these reviewers are paid off. Nobody has mentioned that they don't have kegs or beer on tap. That's right, a bar that serves bottles only.  Once I heard that, I should of just left, but I stuck in there. I ordered a bucket of coronas, which you get 5 of. Happy hour it's 2.50 a piece, now I went on a Saturday night around 8pm. $20 bucks for 5 12 oz bottles. Now my mistake for not asking the price, but in my bar experiences, I never paid 20 bucks for 5 bottles. I also ordered 2 starry night shots, they cost me $6 bucks a piece. $6 bucks for a shot are you freaking kidding me!  It was my brothers birthday, that's why I didn't ask about prices, I thought it would be reasonable based on the reviews here. They even charged me for the $1 bday shot the bartender gave my brother. We didn't even ask for it. So as you can see I am pretty pissed about the whole experience. Also it was quite dead for it being a saturday night, but I don't blame people not coming there. Next time I'll stick to my regular spots.  $36 bucks got me: 5 coronas, 2 shots of starry night and a birthday shot out of a plunger (that's right, a toilet plunger)

HWktBXeW16QPe8gsxExFGg.text: I will never forget my 18th Birthday.  Even though it was over three years ago, I can remember it down to what I was wearing.  Not by how good it was, but by my experience at Dos Gringos.  I have no problems with the servers or the decor.  It was actually quite nice.  My problem was with the food.  I ordered a Carne Burrito with Red Sauce, which is something that I usually get when I am at an authentic mexican restaurant.  From the first bite, I knew that something was amiss.  The first complaint that I have was that the meat was raw.  Not Rare, Not Pink, but Full-on red.  I did not find this out until I was halfway done with the burrito; I thought that all the red juice was from the red sauce that I had ordered... I was wrong.  After asking for it to be recooked, they brought me back a new burrito.  Skeptical, I cut inside, just to take a look... Lo and Behold, more uncooked meat.  Now, at this point, I remember getting queasy.  Not only did I have food poisoning, but I was deeply sick from the raw meat that I had previously eaten.  Needless to say, I found myself in their restroom for an extended period of time.  I have not gone back since.  Some people that I Know believe that I would have a different experience if I returned, but that is not a chance that I will take.  Dos Gringos?  More like Don't Go-go.

DeHCz58miLUSvJKEJokcPQ.text: Came to this location on a Saturday night. It was pretty dead with a few customers. The bartender was really nice and we told him it was our first time there. We ordered chips and salsa with a martini and beer. The chips were great but the martini tasted like juice so we decided to order two shots of my favorite grey goose vodka to get the alcohol kicking.   Things got awkward quickly because the shots tasted like water with a hint of alcohol. My husband hesitated on saying anything because we hate complaining but it was pretty disappointing.  When the bartender came by, my husband politely told him that he isn't trying to say that it was the bartenders fault but the shots we got tasted like water. The bartender immediately got annoyed. He just shrugged his shoulders and said he poured us shots and left it at that. My husband even said that he understands it's probably not the bartenders fault and that we didn't want anything else but thought it would be good for him to know. We've worked in restaurant before and know that sometimes management will water down the bottles. The bartender walked away and we got our check and left after paying.   Unfortunately, we won't be coming back to this place. it was really clear that the staff  had no interest in retaining new customers who were excited about finding a new place to enjoy their weekends.   When I worked in the restaurant business, I alway made sure that first time customers would be a returning customer. Our shots were $9/shot and that's pretty expensive when you feel like you drank water.

ZoPrY1dkXptoXM6y0deMgg.text: The staff was friendly and helpful. Food was off the hook good. Everyone in our party loved what they ordered. I'd eat here all the time if I lived here!

LwqL-pMpxQbjWPO2j2lOkg.text: A dive but great food!  Great service! And in an ok area.  I would go back if in the area.  Nice out door seating.

K-vwuaDLdoJk162wKYN0pA.text: This is the best Dos!  The bartender Chuck is amazing and makes amazing drinks that taste delicious and really sneak up on you. The biggest reason they deserve more than 5 stars is really that they let you bring your dog.. they even bring your dog ICE water.  It is really amazing being able to go somewhere with great food great drinks and an amazing staff and see them treat your dog like a guest as well.  One of the waitresses was even dancing with my dog Sith and really turned an otherwise bad day at work into a really fun worry free night.   I suggest this bar to people almost every day.  It really is a good place to relax even without mans best friend.  Thats just really the vodka soaked cherry on top.

4DdFCG2EDSSzrOOU2kHmYw.text: Nice place to grab some tacos or cheese dip is awesome too. Have a large area available for outdoor seating. I see they host some paint nights too which is cool, but I haven't participated yet. I love that it's close to my home too. Servers have been great so far.

rDAHE-kE9MVeLz2zFxm86g.text: Came here with a group for lunch.  Service was terrible.  No free chips and salsa like every other Mexican restaurant.  Good luck getting a refill. Unfortunately, it was at my suggestion that we came here.

V6gpARiikHdEm1JUqhe9cQ.text: I am Hispanic, and my husband knows how to cook authentic Mexican food. Both of us have worked in the restaurant industry. We have both been to Mexico multiple times. When we want Mexican food, this is one of our spots.   At lunch, the service isn't speedy, but it's not super slow either. They could use more waitresses. The chips and salsa are respectable, not the very best, but good.   The crunchy chicken tacos are literally the best I've ever had. They put guacamole in them, which I've never seen before, and they're delicious. My husband always orders the chimichanga special and he raves about it.   It's kid-friendly too, which is hard to find when you want decent food but can't find a sitter. Our young kids like the games and atmosphere. And I suppose it can be said that dudes would like this place as there are thin young women in tank tops and daisy dukes prancing around. They don't look TOO tacky, but it's a bit more butt cheek than my 13 year old stepson needs to see.

5VT7zy3nQeP7ajudV_4eIw.text: This is a review of the restaurant setting. I walked in after lunch, about 1:00 PM  on a Friday. Dirty tables everywhere, birds flying in and out, all around the place and some settling down on dirty tables inside the restaurant having a feast of their own. The staff didn't seem to be concerned, well it did me. I adios right out of there.  You gotta be KIDDIN!!

zfMUoZU-B6__tbE_M17vhA.text: Yummy food and fun place to eat, but make sure it's at the bar. The servers suck and check in every 15-20 minutes and don't care to smile or take care of you. We waited 10 minutes at our tables before we were helped. The bartender chuck is Amazing and always provides the best service!!!   *alex or aleyx (pronounced a-lex) was our server and we asked for all flour tacos-we later learned these are gringo style- and she gave us street style. I asked her if we could get the correct tacos and she said we ordered flour which is only flour, meat and onions. We went to the bartender, chuck, and asked and he said that gringo was flour with cheese, pico, meat and jalapeno salsa. Later she went up to him saying we ordered street style, which I know for 100% fact that we did not because I ALWAYS order flour tacos and they always come fully loaded. Bartender fixed it right away and left us happy customers!

VWeoC-sy3pEHuJumaWjQ2Q.text: This review is only for their nachos. This place is very close to where I work. More often than not, I'm pressed for time. I personally like the chicken, but add whatever you like. It's your journey. Swing by and try some or if you're like me and are pressed for time, call them in! Enjoy!

0D4Jdr0O9lttK5ifosGBNw.text: Only three stars?  Wow--maybe it was the ambiance that sucks overall here--I don't know.  I actually didn't go here myself.  It was my wife.  She brought me home a cheese enchilada plate and it hit the spot--even lukewarm.  All I know is that meal was better as a leftover than a lot of the fresh ones I've had at taquerias around the tri city area.  Makes me wonder how it would taste if it were nice and hot. . .  Okay--challenge accepted.  I'll let you know.

2-Ud9QUKSwQAzE-WvINhPg.text: Food is delicious, and the kitchen is open late. Drinks can be cheap if you're ordering the right thing. The past couple of times I've been there the service has been slow, unless you sit up at the bar. Employees are pretty nice though!

gZcLPsFBiGFw_BPrT-3dZg.text: We had high hopes...close to our hotel, and we were in town for the Cubs spring training. I mean, after all, they advertise at the games, so it has to be good right?  Ugh...  We went TWICE in 2 days - both times sat outside (on a Thursday and a Friday). Both times the smokers, omg...smokers everywhere outside. We live in Vegas and are used to smokers inside, in the casinos..but even this was over the top...50% smokers outside and no designated spot....nasty.  The happy hour specials are nice, especially the mini chimi's - very tasty!  But here's where the problems arise...the SERVICE. Seriously...between this place and a few others in town, all we can say about Tempe is, it's not a "service town". We had got awful terrible service last night - we wanted to stay longer and order more stuff,  but good lord, we could not get a water refill to save our lives (some random dude finally came and asked if he could refill them - TWICE!) and then we were so fed up due to lack of service we decided to leave and go back our hotel room (at 6 on a Friday nite!) instead of waiting around for the terrible service to come back our way.  Mini chimi's are great....Cadillac margaritas aren't great (tastes like the happy hour ones which were significantly cheaper we assume as we discovered the following night) but the SMOKE is terrible, We ordered Corona Light by the bucket and were served Corona instead. We waited a REALLY long time in between the server stopping by...really? There are also no fans running outside (allegedly there were broken per an overheard conversation) so you cannot go until the sun is down as it will shine on your table and be wretchedly hot!  It looks so fun from the street...and we could have spent a few more hours there, but for gods sake, we couldnt order anything else because our server just stopped coming to see us! We were so pissed off we wrote that on the receipt. My husband who has never written a YELP review in his life felt compelled to write one on this place.  Such high hopes...but ugh...did not live up to what we hoped for. Much better service in our own hotel room!

DxGGGZm2-3jLUIjVJynPlQ.text: I love the atmosphere and feel of this place. I love being able to bring my dog to the nice patio they have available. However, there service is probably the worst I have ever seen! We have gone there multiple times and the service can either be OK or the worst I have ever seen! It takes about 20 mins to order something on average and the waiter or waitress never checks up on you. Then, getting the bill is awful as well! It is like they forget about you! Honestly, I wouldn't go here except for it being close to my house and the environment being very relaxing.

1qMpGwG36P7ifwHHqIeJQQ.text: Listen - this joint is exactly what you have come to expect.  The service is reliable, the beers are always cold and it's the only place other than Mexico that I consistently enjoy Corona.    Their food is good, especially their mini chimis and quest dip - and the ambiance never disappoints.  Dining / drinking outdoors is one of my favorite things about Arizona - and for like 8 months out of the year, this is one of my favorite places to go to happy hour.  Can't go wrong - you'll never be blown away by anything, but it is always consistently better than average!

VfY3lPKdnrR8ujVOXf42LA.text: Came to Dos, and got served by Ally.  She was friendly and made sure we were well served.  Make sure to tip her well.  She is the Best!!!!

Wwd-PY_3G6RkG4SeJmEhHA.text: Cool place to hang out. They had some awesome painting /drinking event going on in the back . They also have corn hole . The nachos were very good t, I highly recommend them  .

photos.caption: Photo of Dos Gringos - Tempe, AZ, United States. Asked for nachos but didn&#39;t expect this awesomeness !

Hwy38kV_9oBZ2ymCAciVdQ.text: There isn't an option to put 0 stars but if there was, this location deserves that. I've been to this location four different times and each time, my service was exceptionally terrible. The only reason I returned was because it was so close to home and the tacos. One time visiting, it was happy hour and none of our drinks were discounted correctly and the server ordered the wrong food....instead of a manger apologizing, the server just said sorry and didnt do anything about it. Pretty professional. This very last time, I knew better, so I set a timer. It took 15 minutes until my friend got fed up and decided to ask a server if we could get some drinks. The drinks came instantly after that, meaning that they weren't busy. But after that, we were told our server would be by shortly for a food order. Another 22 minutes went by until we got another server's attention to get our food order. Some more time went by and our appetizer never arrived but the table in front of us that arrived AFTER us had already received their MAIN meal. We had to remind the server we even ordered an appetizer. She was too busy dancing and talking to the other server to realize we were there. Never offerred refills or asked how the food was, didnt even bring the check. We asked for the manger twice and no one stopped by, yet again. Never returning to this location. Worst service I have EVER experienced.  ***And I'm a server myself, so I can be empathic if it is busy but on all occasions, it was slow.

BQCsiRJHSx2w1dD59NxLDw.text: I absolutely love coming here the staff is always friendly and very welcoming especially Victoria every time I come here with friends or even with my family she is always on top of everything making sure we always have what we need and always with a smile on her face! She truly always makes it an amazing time when we come here!

ifMCVQJbzdUJzt2d-rjlKw.text: This place is pretty gross. Cheese quest was nasty. Chicken fajitas were over cooked no flavor. Only one beer on tap.

I tried to go back again and it was absolutely terrible, I had to go get my own menu and even after that, the girls that work there walked by our table twice to check on their customers and didn't even ask it we needed anything, so after 30 minutes of waiting and no service we decided to leave.

mzenftMk7aiRoj53hdwA3A.text: The food here is gross... really nothing good on the menu... we got a variety of food and it really seemed subpar. The drinks weren't great either... only upside is that the alcohol in each drink seemed to be more than usual, so maybe the drunker you are, the better the food! The restaurant as a whole would be cool but it really seems like a rundown watering hole that people come to, to get drunk.. Will not be returning.

M1Sb-iSdcYJ86-n3Oe5Lag.text: Seriously one of the worst dining experiences Ive ever had. Server seemed annoyed every time she came over to our table and kept saying they were really busy. Food was awful, I ordered the Gringo Wrap and gave up on it half way through. Our server followed up by pouring ice on me and delivering the wrong drinks to us. I informed her about the mistake and she apologized and left to bring me the correct drink. A few minutes later she returned to ask if we needed anything else, but still yet to deliver my correct drink. When I reminded her of this, she seemed upset and annoyed. Finally she returned with my correct drink (dos equis lager bottle). My date asked for the check and our server returned apologizing for the "bad service" and asked if she could "get us anything for free" because she didnt want us leaving "with a bad taste in our mouth". Too late, the Gringo Wrap already did that.  All in all, Im willing to write this off as a bad night for this server. It didnt appear busy to me, and I saw another server possibly training a third server. However it doesnt excuse the lack of management. No one ever came by to touch our table and ask how everything was. A capable manager should have at least helped this server run food and drinks.

RnNPG2RBrjbQ8_Eqvtxa0A.text: I love this place for a quick and relaxing lunch.  Very casual and the price is right!  If you are expecting authentic Mexican then you've got the wrong spot... I wouldn't even classify it as Tex-Mex... So what it is it?  It's just good old Americanized Mexican style food that fills you up for a good price and provides a laid back and loose environment.  Good service from quality servers that remember you and what you like and drop it on you every time you grab a table.  Outside tables are perfect for this time of year and it is the best atmosphere for conversation and relaxing during a busy day.  If you want to lighten your day, grab a partner and trundle on over.  Just awesome!

2l_RnZSqvypjZeymhDLEuw.text: THEY DO NOT HAVE NFL SUNDAY TICKET! Do not go there if you are looking to watch football. Otherwise, I really enjoy their food. I wish that I could get everything in one spot

YqX3WsFNpboYnKeITCn50Q.text: The food was pretty good after we finally got waited on by a waiter from another part of the restaurant.  He recognized we looked a bit exasperated at the wait and came over to rescue us!  Bravo to this waiter who took the initiative; wish we had gotten his name.  The best part of our meal was the ice-cold Corona's with lime!  The atmosphere is absolutely great; almost feels like you've stepped into old Mexico!  We'll be coming back to see if there is some improvements.

They have big open patios perfect for sipping on Coronas and they've got decent Bloody Mary bars on Sundays.   The Carne tacos are cheap and delicious, and they have crazy specials during games. This is a great place for groups or lazy day drinking.

_19Ne9TO3tAdOBQ2LO9vqQ.text: Fish tacos were good. That's about it. Very unfriendly and we were sitting at the bar!   Menu very ala cart.

6WubOlmxaXc0Ids_AubN_w.text: My boyfriend and I usually go to the dealerships around the block to get our cars serviced. While we are waiting, we walk over to Dos for some drinks and food. Cheryl always takes really great care of us! The gringo tacos are delicious!

ZAp1-1nQJE6zpldq-exYCw.text: Stopped by during a business trip. Great, super casual atmosphere. Fantastic food and great service!

Z1DqVL9SZdIUz5JYQLrfQw.text: Was here visiting friends and stopped here for libations.  Tasty and strong margaritas.  So strong that my friend could barely finish hers.  It was cold and the heater was awesome.  We had a fun time and the servers were very attentive.  Also, they had an inflatable snowman as a holiday decoration, and a drunk guy came up and punched it and then tried to get in the bar.  He was summarily denied access.  Good call, bouncer, good call...

bC4n65wKhLdfI9u1fmcGzg.text: I absolutely love this place, it really is the "perfect place to day drink!" The service is always amazing, the food is even better!!! I have yet to have on thing on the menu that I didn't like. Try the Pork Chile Dip to start, finish with some Crispy Tacos...or for something lighter the Chipotle Chicken Salad is BOMB. Everyone there is always trying to have a good time, you won't be disappointed!

EwUn3sC-3FvFIGMTYpZWTQ.text: This staff is the rudest bunch of people to work in a restaurant. They make you feel like they want you to leave as soon as you sit down, and ordering anything was the biggest imposition on our waitress. I could almost hear her sigh heavily when we asked for water and when she brought a pitcher the cups were floating on the water inside the pitcher. I dont want her fired, I want her to quit because she clearly hates working there.

w1CdxJ0A4Kev9lq3ptRWzg.text: Foods good enough.  Nothing great. The grilled shrimp and grilled Mahi flour tacos are my favorite. I don't drink so I can only rate the lemonade...as good. Tuesday nt is open mic night. Some humor.

dJtWVWJ4Y09MwomGOTF78w.text: Food is ok but I've definitely had better. Services, sucks. Waitresses are only there to look pretty and hope to get picked up by a cute guy. (NOT JUST 1 WAITRESS, ALL OF THEM)

PAURPSh1HKSQMEQ9QKDPMg.text: I work at Target.com off priest and so before going in I decided to stop by this place and I ordered shredded chicken nachos to try them out they were $9. It was nice size portion, worth the money i paid for it. I wouldn't say the same for the guacamole it was an extra $1 put wasn't that big. Very good wouldn't mind taking others there to try it!

photos.caption: Photo of Dos Gringos - Tempe, AZ, United States

Zn-AOHWEy-1zbjO1NMBRDg.text: Went on a Sunday. Awesome patio. Very cheap Corona. Live original music. Service was very good, chips and salsa very good. Their queso dip is loaded and delicious. Only thing that was disappointing was their mahi and shrimp tacos.   Would definitely get drunk on the patio again but next time I will only eat chips, salsa, and queso.

8_O-qH5x02pMC0NgqrYajA.text: Service was slow. Didn't really care for this place. People there were lame. Not a big menu selection.

WbavtGwUrr5-3a10t1zzXQ.text: Went here last night for paint nite.  Not a bad place but also nothing truly special. Very generic tacos and margaritas.  We got the queso dip for 8 bucks and 5 street size tacos for 10 bucks. The margaritas were average. Again nothing special setting this place from any other Mexican food stop.we ordered a starter and the tacos. They came at the same time and before our drinks.   I'd probably try another location.

X0HeW2s2o0oiXSiJvH-kNg.text: Erin, brittany, Chris vella, Alexander Washington, and dez taylor have consistently delivered such a high level of customer service individually and as a group when we bring parties to dos gringos Tempe that this is my friends and I first choice when we elect to eat GREAT food, drinks, and have an overall friendly and inviting atmosphere. Each time I walk in my expectations are exceeded. I can't say enough great things about this location.

O_gVJ0MmoJsFfbL4ETomww.text: Unless you hit this spot for happy hour, my opinion is that the bottled beers are pretty expensive. Furthermore, I feel like this place could use more beers on draft. The location and the casual, outdoor atmosphere make this a cute lil drinkin hole, but I can think of a few more places that I would choose on a regular basis because of my two above complaints- expensive BOTTLED beer and basically 0 selection in draft beer.

photos.caption: Photo of Dos Gringos - Tempe, AZ, United States. Happy birfday happy hours with some co-worker, fellow pisces friends o mines!
Photo of Dos Gringos - Tempe, AZ, United States. Awesome 2 for $5 diablo tacos special that day!

AoUEZHsIcNFDd6dgBPOtJQ.text: I went to Dos Gringos after work to relax , only to have been met with TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!! waitress notified our group that she had to leave, she offered to transfer our tab to another waitress only to return twenty minutes later to inform us that all other waitresses refused to service us , because our group was sitting outside. ( which was under shade and with misters on I might add). I will never recommend Dos Gringos to anyone!

nlHG9kjcdi254fJGbKaIqA.text: This is our favorite happy hour spot! It's got a great outdoor patio. Order the Mexican iceberg for your drink. It's a margarita with an upside down bottle of beer inside. Even though it's on the menu, sometimes the waitresses don't know what it is, so I have had to explain it to them. I always order an appetizer for my meal, and that's the pulled pork mini chimis. They are so damn good... They recently updated the outdoor tv's, and the place needs some new paint, but we will keep coming back either way.

wyoLpfzBIkIf5tAhELrOng.text: This place sucks. Waitress completely ignored us for about 20 mins. Went to Bogeys instead.

HHTpqVD3nbuxhXg09f2Iuw.text: I go here for the cheap happy hour beers and the company. I usually sit at the bar. The seating has gotten better but when they put the backs on the chairs people would lean back and almost break them. The cushions fabric on the chairs make you sweat badly and the concrete bar table will burn your arms in the summer and they are in the shade. The food is good and cheap. The bar waitress are good but sometimes you get that "one" who won't pay attention to you at all. I think she is more concerned about popping out those fake boobs at everyone. The parking isn't that great.

M3p0Z5qwIceWnynSQw-GhQ.text: THE BEST DOS GRINGOS! By far the best there is. Not only do they have the best bartender (chuck) who makes you feel at home, he makes the best drinks and ALWAYS makes sure you're taken care of. The music is great, the drinks are great and the food even taste better at this location. I live 5 minutes from the Mesa one but I gladly make the 20 minute drive to dos gringos in Tempe.

photos.caption: Photo of Dos Gringos - Tempe, AZ, United States. Grilled chicken street tacos with chips and salsa! Always the best!

fBHWNSg88hZK8o3pamE-rg.text: Food is great and the salsa is out of this world!! The patio had a fun atmosphere, too!  I would recommend this place to anyone.

_wywOdvqETINSTl2IJsNkg.text: I had been in Tempe for two days and hadn't gotten any Mexican food - how is that possible?  So when my friends asked what I wanted for dinner I said "TACOS!" and off to Dos Gringos we went.  The food is pretty decent - not the best I've ever had, but I'd certainly go back.  The salsa seemed fresh, and I liked that there was a big variety of meats for the tacos, and you could get them prepared three different ways (gringo, tex mex, and something else that escapes me).    The service was a little flaky, but nothing offensive.

4lxFGjJgaYjJ-nupfsI6Hw.text: Come here expecting a bar with bar food, and you will not be disappointed. Don't come here and expect legit Mexican food. The queso tastes like what you'd buy at the store, and the chips were stale. The. Chips. Were. Stale. That's almost hard to do. The only reason I'm even giving two stars is because the outdoor area is cool, and they allow dogs.

SpXjQDU5ibXRUcLmfuBjLQ.text: Chuck & Nicole, Our Favorite Bartenders......We Love You~?!.....And To Be Clear.....Shane & "ALL" The Staff~!   It's Our "Cheers"~!   This Time We Had Beer And Wings~!  YUMMO~!  THE DJ ROCKED THE HOUSE~!   We Just Love This Place~!

N5rYkBweht_ABXSbzyF_-g.text: I typically love Dos Gringos and believed they had the best chimichanga in the Valley.  I ordered the SuperGooeyCheesyChimichanga as I always do when we make the annual trip but the meat just tasted dried out and was probably a little overcooked.  Was also upset to hear they closed the Scottsdale location.  I'll be back again but hope the meat is more edible next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Dos Gringos - Tempe, AZ, United States. Supergooeycheesy chimichanga
Photo of Dos Gringos - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chips &amp; salsa.  Green salsa is hotter than we expected.

8BmNZh0lF-bFswuP7nbP7Q.text: Been coming for 10 years, love this place and the staff. They make you feel like its home. Thank you John, Nicole, chuck, vic and chase!

Zx-WyXW1HkzkKYcHalzTHA.text: This place rocks, been coming here for years and the staff is always smiling and attentive.  The menu has continually evolved for the better with innovations in flavor and the emergence of house made sauces and drink mixes.  They also have a brand new cocktail menu that is off the charts.  Do not be deceived by the dive patio look.  This place has it going on for your food and drinking needs.  Victoria rocks Saturdays!

wsh2VF1Y8L5a7PylP26vMA.text: Thank you Victoria!! For being brought up to a bartender from a server so soon, you continue to have a great attitude, be on top of the regulars, as well as helping out your servers!!! I will definitely be back on your shifts!

Ohcx72p3AvEQbSDuvXPPXw.text: Katie was a great server!!! We had a party of quite a few women and she made it the best night possible for us! I wish I could rate her more than 5 stars! I will most definitely be back!

90i2U0r5FLhZdbv4rp8-JA.text: Did gringos itself has great food. Than being said that's all they have. Been twice to the same location and both times been walked by by several waiters and waitresses without being helped for about 20-25 minutes.  The place is not crowded or full whatsoever so I'm not sure as to why the wait was so long while others where being served around me.   I gave it a second chance because the food was good but  I won't be coming back after the same service and no change. Both visits about a month apart.  Like I said they have good tacos and that's it.

Jfti1DeKJAkudrTQPyYj5Q.text: Like coming here.  Good food. Never to packed.  But they always get a dj who cranks the music up so dang loud to where no one is dancing. No one is parting.   But it is so dang loud that you can not here friends.  They have games witch is awesome but you are right in front of the speakers of the dj.   Noticed that our group is coming here less and less due to the dj.  Having a dj normally is wonderful and welcome. But. They play the music so loud that I stopped drinking. And switched to water.... I know it sounds like I'm whining about the dj but it has been the same for the last 4 times I have been here.  Disappointed with this dos....

photos.caption: Photo of Dos Gringos - Tempe, AZ, United States

HJB3dOd8uwP79aQtg22AfQ.text: Beware. On taco Tuesday you have to specify that you want regular tacos or they bring you these tiny excuses for a meal. I thought I was getting crunchy tacos. The waitress said it's the customers responsibility to know what they are ordering. She didn't think it's her responsibility to ask the customer if they want street tacos or crunchy. A guy came by who said he was a manager and when I complained he said "Next time you'll know". There won't be a next time buddy. You can go so many more places in Tempe for taco Tuesday. And I will.

0aL-39dRG2vyD08yu5Ffrw.text: Thank you Nicole for always taking such care of us!! You always make our experience so fun and provide excellent service!!! We'll be back to see you soon!!!

izLY87QfPPdZXCKmtVwO1w.text: Ordered pick and got the combo and they forgot my rice and beans  shoulda checked the box before I left...other than that it's delicious as always

photos.caption: Photo of Dos Gringos - Tempe, AZ, United States

DPif4DYIx5a49GU6B1bNEg.text: Got a beer and chips and the beer was really cold and they didn't charge me for the chips.  The salsa was good but could have been just a bit spicier.

Xi30or3q4qOxE-uSYEwmHw.text: This place is absolutely horrible. Don't waste your time. We found a table that had less empty drinks and trash than the rest, waited about 10 minutes for a server to come clear the table. Took 15 minutes to get water. Brought out food (half the order because the other half had water spilled on it) and when we asked for more nacho cheese it took the waitress 20 minutes to bring back a tiny cup of shredded cheese. We NICELY asked for melted queso, the waitress rolled her eyes and brought back queso about 5 minutes later. The second half of our order came out and it was wrong. It was taken back and brought out correctly another 10 minutes later. THEN we were waiting and waiting for our check, 30 minutes after waiting my friend went inside to find our waitress and she was leaning against the wall talking to her coworkers. We asked for the check and explained that due to being at the restaurant for almost 2 hours, only ordering 2 appetizers, we would appreciate talking to the manager about the service. The manager refused to come to our table so my friend had to go inside to talk to him, he argued with her and told her she didn't know what she saw then asked "well you got your food, didn't you? Then why are you here talking to me?"  I'm appalled at this whole experience and wish I could give negative stars. I've never had such horrible service and been treated so poorly in my whole life.

OH50oWBvXCyrCG7ctTCXpw.text: I want to update my review from several years because The current manager sent a 25$ for me to try the restaurant again, 7 , yes ,7 years later. So that in itself is worth an extra star.  This time around : No one acknowledged us when we walked in. We had to seat ourselves. Our waitress was nice and did a decent job. The salsa was good but they charge for chips and salsa and charge extra for more salsa. But the food was good.   All in all, it's average ,So that is why my rank is still a 3/5 add an extra star for the manager who is striving for more.

DvbzaU7-zRk6Wj1GToAr6w.text: Dos gringos is always good for taco Tuesday! I've been to all locations and have had decent experiences at all  Tempe location is definitely my favorite. They tacos and burritos are my favorite. Margaritas are mediocre but it's a fun, relaxed place! They have big Jenga which I always look forward to playing- even better, they have corn hole!

photos.caption: Photo of Dos Gringos - Tempe, AZ, United States

MDxwyzYEXca_PL_h_gh0hg.text: Tonight I was looking for some evening entertainment. I wanted something fun but without a lot of noisy crowds. Dos Gringos was the perfect choice. The outdoor seating provides a lovely area to relax with friends while enjoying some food and drinks. An added bonus was the outdoor games (I got to practice my mad Jenga skills). Everything was very reasonably priced. They had taco Tuesday going on, which I'm always a fan of and definitely took advance of.  The food was good and the drinks were strong. They also had some stand-up comedians preforming which was extremely entertaining. The staff was very friendly and efficient. Overall, a fabulous place to come for adult fun.

photos.caption: Photo of Dos Gringos - Tempe, AZ, United States. Yummy

GVb4BtWlaEVE_PtGH5d_Vw.text: I just paid 17.20 for a Carne Asada Burrito. I thought I would grab a quick lunch. I tipped $2.00 for the togo service. The burrito had no meat and tons of rice with carrots and peas? Very Very disappointed.  Dang trick me once my fault, well needless to say I will never go back. Taco Bell has much better food. I should have asked around the office before I went.

fM3gyx8dHH3RapN0jv54nA.text: Taco Tuesdays! Nom. Really good deals on their Monster Tacos (three bucks per), cervezas and tequila drinks. They also had other taco options that were also good deals. We ordered (party of two) a total of four chicken-chorizo Monster Tacos. They were a good deal for their price point, but be sure to add a side of sour cream, quac and/or salsa as the tacos are bland AF.  Why the two stars for Dos Gringos? The service there is sslllloooowww. Es muy lento! From the time we arrived and were acknowledged to the random table check ups, the service was sslllloooowww. Our waitress even forgot to bring back our card after charging it, leaving us to hunt for her after ten minutes. Apparently it got "too busy" for her although there was only one other table of eight aside from us. Yikes. Best of luck on the assumably busier weekend shift.

photos.caption: Photo of Dos Gringos - Tempe, AZ, United States. Monster Tacos! Fried flour tortilla FTW.

qKBhxyuJkk6OQ5sVVT1IVQ.text: Slow service, it was lunch time, huge restaurant, two servers??? I got the "Monster taco" it came in a fried flour shell and looked pretty impressive at first glance until I realized the bottom third of the taco was pinched shut with no filling at all. I got the carnitas and the filling was basically roasted pork with almost no spice or seasoning. The rice was pretty decent, the beans were straight out of a can and they'd doctored them with cayenne pepper? They were slightly spicy and not good at all. Anyway, great atmosphere, so if that's what you're looking for you'll like it. However, if it's about the food, give this place a pass.

ahNSjMO4vtq-iSO5SS8jzA.text: I'll start off by saying, I haven't been to a Dos Gringos in 2 years; however, when I did go, I loved their Sunday morning Bloody Mary bar!    Last Sunday my wife and I went to this Dos Gringos and it was exactly how I remembers it... for the most part. It was fresh with plenty of goodies to toss in our drinks. I popped in some jalapeno, olives with red pepper flakes, little tiny onions, Tabasco and then... I was in a panic!! There was no bacon!! I asked the near by waitress and she apologetically said that they didn't have bacon strips to go with it. I felt a little let down, but all in all, it was still pretty darn tasty. The freshness of the other stuff made everything ok. The bacon though... that would have gotten them the fifth star ;)

WqwyBA_yNB2Zi5IQdYBtwA.text: Green chile dip looked like a baby threw up on a plate then they just put a dollop of sour cream, chips on the side and charged $10 for it. Service was slow. $6 Margaritas served in small plastic disposable cups. Steer clear of this train wreck.

ZTlweEBzPV24OfTMZBvIaQ.text: Has potential, but 110db (about as loud as a jet taking off)  headbanger music chosen by a 15 year old and very poorly prepared food make this non-Mexican food joint hard to recommend.  Avoid this restaurant.

4V4Fk5co4W_tjGaK_mDXNg.text: I went to Dos Gringos for tacos on a rainy night. It was cold out, so I asked the server if we could get the heaters turned on. She was super helpful and said she would grab the General Manager for me. The GM came over to our table about 5 minutes later and without even saying a word to us, he started messing with the heater. 2 seconds later, he said "it doesn't work" and walked away from the table. He didn't say a word to us, and didn't even have the respect for his customers to communicate what issue was going on with the heater. He seemed annoyed and "put out" that we needed wanted the heater on.  He walked away from our table and we never saw him again... like AT ALL. I'm honestly so disappointed at the management there, and I would NOT recommend dining here for that reason.

8TnnojxSJWAQD6oKXvPnwQ.text: Great for drinking beers and happy hour. Good chips and salsa. The service was poor. The waitress didn't know a lot of things and couldn't answer questions. Bummed the restaurant wouldn't let us do a liberty shot. I would come back for happy hour.

A29lOltHAjZEPX1pj6zqdw.text: Fantastic food. We started off with the mini Jimmie's which I could've eaten about six more platters of. Went with the monster taco and the Carnitas tacos. Very impressed with the atmosphere. Will definitely come back and tell others to try.

spLzJVUkUvHdTYevdCJuFQ.text: Came here with my daughter. We missed lunch while we were out car shopping...so we had a linner! Lunch/dinner.  My first question to the waitress....do you have any IPAS. They did have Lugunitas IPA,  good start. We each ordered Carne Asada  street tacos....we were so hungry I was down to the last bite on my 2nd taco and realized I didn't take a picture....we ordered another round of crispy tacos with ground beef. Once again so hungry I forgot to take pictures.....uhh   The tacos here are really good. We got chips and salsa and they were good too, salsa was a little mild it could be taken up a notch.  We ate on the patio and they are dog friendly. The place is clean no issues there. We had a really good waitress and she took really good care of us and I didn't catch her name.   I would definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Dos Gringos - Tempe, AZ, United States. Beers! Cheers!
Photo of Dos Gringos - Tempe, AZ, United States. Tuesday specials

F2hiDVUZsLJMQAtPRD2xSQ.text: Listen...I use to love this bar, but the people that come to it are unstable and obnoxious...They call themselves regulars but really they are just Children. I know the boundaries of Adulthood and Drunk-ness, but I'm not sure the Bartenders know the limitations of customer service and Reality. I'm not going to go into a long story about who's right and who's wrong...But will say I wouldn't waste my Time Telling You "Why to Come to this Place"...I promise you are talking to someone that can handle the Worst in any situation but as a Black Man, I wouldn't want anyone to experience this kind of Savagery at least before 8pm...If you do come to this establishment after 9pm...Make sure you have a Good Friendship with the Bartender and At Least a Group of 3 People" #FuckThisDosGringos  I promise I will Demolish you for Threatening My Life!!!!!

r2KvQIMJF7RY85WcKhA8kw.text: It was our first time at a Dos Gringos location. Our server/ bartender Rad was awesome. He was quick with our orders and very nice to us. We will be visiting this location again when we are in the area and need a tasty meal and cold beers. Thanks Rad and the Dos Gringos crew. See you all soon.

jKjpAIACKF6znF0W2XrMpA.text: Beware. Went in on taco Tuesday and told the waitress we were there for the taco special. She brought us tiny street tacos. I had four and it was a poor excuse for a meal. The waitress was unappologetic saying it's the customers responsibility to know what they are ordering. I said... as the waitress... she should have asked if we wanted street tacos or crispy tacos. The "manager" (I doubt he was) said "next time you'll know". No next time. This was the first time and the last time buddy. It will be Filibertos on taco Tuesday for me. They are huge and flavorful and only $1.50.

photos.caption: Photo of Dos Gringos - Tempe, AZ, United States. Beware. On $3 taco Tuesday they bring these tiny excuses for a meal.

fjVPglGJ9nDokMr9xUblAw.text: I come here weekly and this place is far beyond just a bar & restaurant! Not only do they have incredible food/drinks, fun activities (bags, darts, giant jenga), music, but  also the best staff I've ever encountered. They remember your name, Victoria never lets your drink go empty, Ricky is the best bartender in town, and everyone always make sure you're having a great time. The GM is friendly and always out talking to everyone, the DJ on Thursday nights has the place rocking. Highly recommend!!

idcbJ7S5NMOM8QBXj8y5_w.text: Dos Gringos is a top notch place. I come every Thursday night after kickball and every waitress and bartender is friendly. The beer and alcohol is the same as every other place in the area but the people are much better. I highly recommend coming here on a Thursday or a weekend to meet a class staff and to have fun with everyone that comes here. 5 stars mike out

4nsJ65wHP5sDSoW8vLO5eg.text: I ALWAYS receive top notch customer service here at Dos Gringos. I came here on a Tuesday just to unwind and forget about all my problems of the day and I did just that. Chuck and Victoria are always on the job and I feel Dos is lucky to have them. I will definitely come back and I highly recommend others to do the same.

Utmb9yBkCS5_UQReCH4xqA.text: I frequent this bar. Service is always amazing! The food is fantastic especially that they cater to vegetarians! The veggie tacos are indescribably delicious!

AYFA4LX8n-HEb_X5y6k8XQ.text: Two stars for the decent food and the male Bartender. Aside from that,  this place is a joke.  I ordered a drink from my server and after 15 minutes (any time I approached her to ask she just walked by ignoring eye contact) I decided to hit the bar. The fellow behind the bar apologized and although not swifty, made me a cocktail.  The second drink I ordered was through the female bartender.  After sitting patiently for 10 minutes I asked if she had forgot my order....yep! And it happened to most of our party. He was great, she was awful.  Moral of the story is just that. I won't be back here again voluntarily.

6YrCdYD8-P5pyQPf78-vIQ.text: Always as fan of a place with Pacifico and good shrimp tacos. Very chill and never disappointed. Not a lot of extras, just a good place to hang with friends.

gr_f5iSCsVrZXjPwMGwfGw.text: I'd give 0 stars if I could.  The racism I witnessed by the management was cringey.  The waitress we had was nice but that doesn't compensate for the ignorant behavior I saw displayed to another customer. Never going again, not even to another location.

zh9R8gKatehs-ZNObjN4EQ.text: I am pretty sensitive to spicy foods so I am careful with Mexican restaurants. We came here for fajitas and the carnitas was horrible. The chicken and shrimp were both super spicy as is their rice. They said everything is marinated beforehand so they can't make it differently. Another time, I tried tacos and mini chimis - both were VERY SPICY. They only give you one thing of chips and salsa and charge for chips thereafter. Also, if you sit outside, beware of smokers. I learned something new. I didn't think smoking was allowed inside or outside of restaurants but there were people smoking. As a cancer thriver I'm very careful about that. One time, we caught our server taking a vap hit from a guy.   I've been here enough times to know that it's not for me.

Mab7K9Gs2RRuuHHfkndurw.text: Service, Staff, and are always awesome. I love Tacos  .  Taco Tuesday specials $2 crispy Beef tacos are my favorite. Chuck, Victoria, Dano and the rest of the staff keep this cantina the popping local hang out for new or local patrons. Come have fun with them and enjoy the environment.

nvYVI0ZF2dvwThUkliOQaQ.text: I love coming to Dos Gringos for one reason...the waitress Erin. She is awesome! The food is pretty good (always get the chicken and chorizo tacos that Erin suggested) but the smiles and great conversation and service is the best around! Always a good time and atmosphere!

aK5_abZlWHX9j3fvi3h4BQ.text: Middle of the day with 15 people max at the restaurant. It has taken 45 minutes for 6 tacos..... tacos yes the food item that takes 5 minutes at home to prepare. Only 2 heaters work outside and had to move tables to get one that works. Haven't had the food yet. It better be fantastic or the rating is the same

noCdnPNbjS1i3Rd3FAZpDA.text: Total dive, exactly what we wanted. Outside seating area was weathered but comfortable. Was able to feel the sun while having a margarita.  Can't beat that. After a few questions about the food, we made a choice of something cheeseygooeygood. The jalapeno cream sauce on the top could be put on an old shoe, and I would eat it. Salsa had the perfect amount of heat, chips fresh. Drinks cold. Waitress was always quick with drink refills.

photos.caption: Photo of Dos Gringos - Tempe, AZ, United States

Nmfl0G3QZob96PKAftgGSA.text: Great atmosphere, friendly staff, and decent food. They have large homemade Jenga blocks and horse shoes for patrons to play. The Mexi Fries and queso are great appetizers as they taste fresh and have just enough spice.

photos.caption: Photo of Dos Gringos - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mexi Fries
Photo of Dos Gringos - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chips and queso
Photo of Dos Gringos - Tempe, AZ, United States

BMMqajx5SZQEC2tMYGL3-A.text: Sign of trouble to come when we stepped out of the car onto a freshly used condom. Worst Mexican food we have ever had. Green chile  chimi was old dry dry dry pork...where was the green chile....complained and was told....that's the way we make it....really? Beans have no flavor and the street tacos are much better at Del Taco...Dirty tables,floors,bathrooms etc.. ....Never again

mheEpUbMj7GTTiIC2_z1UQ.text: Really great experience, the food was awesome and I loved the staff. I was bummed it was jammin' busy for how awesome i thought it was so, GO CHECK IT OUT! I live to far away to go there regularly but I would go all of the time if they had one in North Phoenix. The manager was extra cool and made sure we were good at all times. When I go to the eastside it will be my go to Mexican Grill!

Z0yqFEn9y0r9DMWYDM-f0A.text: We always have fun here. There's giant Jenga and Connect 4 and seriously, try the nachos with a margarita. My only complaint is that they don't have pina coladas, but' a minor gripe. Great place.

osTBpDPYrQuWEyBxFp-RiA.text: Not a fan. Local organizations (Apollo Group, US Airways, Intel) converge on this location making it a difficult experience. If you do go on a weekend night, be ready to navigate that small parking lot.

90BA_2kyLrJkcrdBlLptpw.text: All of the dos gringos are about the same, unique atmosphere but food isnt that great and only beer on special is pacifica. Does have some games like bean bag toss so its an decent place to hang out in the late evenings but I never eat there anymore.

NQy5Cr2hFHG4zNk9l7oRCw.text: It sure isn't authentic Mexican food, but why fool ourselves.  That's not why we're here.  We're here for our nacho fix and some Mexican Moonshine at noon and it always fits the bill.  The food is as it says it is on the menu, the prices are fair and as a bonus to y'all, I went out on a limb and tried the ceviche.  I would definitely order it again.

_AEfDWtYKww2tdyvek5wbQ.text: If you want to sit on the patio at a meat-market, have we found the place.  if you are looking for good food with your beverage, it may not really be the place to go...  not horrible but nothing to go out of your way for.   It does have the "beach vibe" somewhat, but really there are much better places for this 40 yearold to go.

Q0M0Cvj3lcDsB8dsGZOfBQ.text: When we arrived we sat ourselves it was pretty busy on the patio. We were there for a birthday celebration. The service was terrible we had to walk up to the bar to order drinks and flag down a waitress to give us menus to take our food order 45 minutes later. Lemon drop shot tasted nasty for 7.00 wasnt worth the tsp of liquor in the huge shot glass. We then tried amf's ( 8.00) while the first round was good the 2nd and  3rd were too sweet and didnt taste like the first. My friend asked if the bartender could re make her drink and the bar tender manager that was making the drinks i believe her name is miranda got rude and upset. Said shes remade the drink 3 times and that we had 30 minutes to finish what drinks we had. What she didnt know is the drinks were for individual people but didnt bother to ask. And had a bouncer of a bar come and stand by our tables and watch the clock till our time ran out to make sure we would leave. When sitting there with a group of people for 3+ hours and then asking why the drink is now tasting too sweet and not like the first ones you ordered and being asked to leave obviously your customer is never right. While we were told to take up our complaint with manager joey of the store we decided it wasnt worth our time as we will find a new place to celebrate with our family and friends on birthday occasions and take our money elsewhere. My advice for the cost of drinks and the not so awesome service go someplace else.

llcPLB6g4hJxCzZyXWEefQ.text: Let me just start by saying, NEVER GO TO A MEXICAN RESAURANT CALLED DOS GRINGOS(Spanish for two white guys)!!!  It's plain and simple a bar.  We walked in and were greeted by an outdoor area where music was blaring.  There was birdpoop on the floor and benches!!! We had to ask 3 servers before one finally told us that we can sit wherever we want.  All around us people were smoking and drinking shot after shot.  And the servers were even worse!!! They were all girls walking around in practically bikinis!!! We had to ask FOUR different ladies for just a side of beans before one finally understood our request.  In the middle of our "dinner", we heard yelling and realized that just feet away from our table-with children-, the bartender and a bunch of customers were playing bar games!!! Completely inappropriate for a so called "family environment"!!!  Why have a kid menu?  With the food, we had to ask about pretty much everything because the menu was very confusing(half of the FOOD menu was a tequila menu!).  Half of my table had to order something else after finishing eating because the serving sizes are ridiculous( and the food was terrible)!!!  We all left starving with smoke in our nostrils. If you want to party at the bar, go here.  If you wan Mexican food, or have children, find somewhere else!

Zlspi6P5k38P-2e1sU9Zaw.text: Meh....its really cool looking for just drinks and a good time...I didn't like the food very much at all.  I had the street tacos and just wasn't too happy with the quality of the food...I don't know if it sat too long, or if thats just how it always is?  But the fish pieces were really good!  The service could be a little better, but overall its OK.

2YLi-aYSUc5XixGSWTR7cQ.text: This is definitely one of my favorite hangouts for fun, food and drinks. The service hasn't been consistent over the last decade, but it has definitely been going up again. There are finally servers who know how to keep you from going empty on your drinks and cooks doing a great job on the food. I have been very impressed with my last few visits and plan to make this a regular place to hang out again. Keep up the good work Dos!

6_KHdzicVMOOloNk3U1pEQ.text: I am very surprised to see such high ratings for this place.  The ONLY thing going for Dos Gringos is the atmosphere.  It looks like it would be a fun place to hang out and have a cocktail with friends.  That is, if you can actually carry on a conversation without going hoarse because you have to yell to be heard over the blaring music.   This was our first visit to Dos Gringos.  My husband and I went out without the kids during this visit.  I saw that they had a kids menu but didn't look at prices or choices.  The food was extremely disappointing.  the chips were obviously dumped out of a bag somewhere in the back and the salsa was....bland.    I ordered a pick two combo which came with mini (very mini, three bite tacos - could have been one bite for my husband) , flautas and rice and beans.  I swear that there could not have been more than 1 Tbsp of meat in each taco and flauta.  I don't think that the flautas actually had meat in them.  I take that back, a disgusting charred bit of steak fell out of it on my last bite.  My husband ordered 2 street tacos with rice and beans.  He ended up with substantially more food at a cheaper price than mine.  His tacos looked decent, but the meat I tasted was unimpressive.   We don't plan on going back to Dos Gringos anytime in the near future.  Even the chain restaurants have them beat and that's not saying much!    My rating: Blech

o0mqQ5ZM5FBt9rua3gOI9Q.text: This place has always been douchbag central in my eyes, the one by ASU anyway, but I came to this new location last night for a going away party, and was pleasantly surprised. It reminded me of an ice house, but classier, with misters and food and a decent drink menu. They also play really fantastic music.. first 4 songs were all some of my favorite bands, including Passion Pit who came out of Boston, which was shocking.. and radical. Cant say Ive been to any other place that had such an impressive play list, and I am a bit of a music snob. Their nachos were enormous, and delightful, I ate every last bite, and then indulged myself in 2 more tacos after I had 3 more $2 Pacificos. Luckily for me my metabolism is amazing so I can do things like this, and I could have kept eating too because the tacos were delicious. I tried both chicken and steak, equally amazing. Our waitress was very patient, even though it was a table of 20 drunk ex co-workers of McFarlane Toys, which translates into 20 drunk super-nerds discussing comic books and video games.. She kept our drinks flowing and the food coming without missing a beat. I could tell she was overwhelmed, but nice work anyhow.. way to keep your cool. I did enjoy this place, but I am taking into account that it was Tuesday night, and really, no one else was in there.. so on a busy night this place could quite possibly suck, or be an exact replica of the Dos Gringos I used to know and had no problem forgetting.. either way, I had a good time, and I cant deny a place that has excellent music.

photos.caption: Photo of Dos Gringos - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Dos Gringos - Tempe, AZ, United States

72CnzBbH0sbvn9rTBei9uQ.text: i'm not usually one to patron dos, especially on a crazy day like cinco de mayo, but after relocating to south tempe my options are severely limited on bars i can (or want) to ride my bike to. on a huge DUI enforcement night, bikes were in order and when i found out a brand new dos was opening here i couldn't argue.  it's what you've come to love about this trailer park/rocky point - inspired chain of bar/restaurants. i arrived at about 5 on 5/05 and it the patio was already packed. no cover, and no tables either. big patio and more inside seating at tables than usual. i understand this is supposed to be a more "grown up" dos, more family friendly with a more elaborate menu. it was certainly not family friendly on cinco! ha, i left the craziness at about 7 to watch the fight at a nearby club, and heard from a friend who worked that night that there were more than a few fights - including a girl getting jumped in the bathroom, but that's all heresay and conjecture at this point. good to see grown ups with families still know how to get out of control wasted on holidays and try to kill each other.   but seriously, i can't complain, i was treated very nice by the staff and managers because i had worked with them in the past, and they're more than cool and down to earth. only downside (aside from the basic bro element associated with all dos') is no designated bike locking area, but after seeing how many bikes were there that night, hopefully they'll get a set up.

aIXTD4Yfq5B06iB3us-VqQ.text: Ewwww!  Fun looking place, but as a first timer I was thoroughly disappointed.  Happy hour on Friday and was shocked at the lackluster drinks.  If you don't want beer, don't come here!!  Margarita was tasteless and so iced/watered down thought it was lemonade.  Ordered a cocktail and 3 times in a row it was not made correctly at all.  Again, weak & watered down... and it was a pure alcohol cocktail, no mixer!!  Food... chips/salsa & some other chip mess... should have went across the street to Costco & got some 3# bag of chips & cheese whiz!

6Ke9YUCuzIqR_bCX0aG9sA.text: This review is for the Chandler location.  The food here is pretty good. We came here twice during my last visit to AZ. We tried the nachos, the 7 layer dip, the guac and chips. The nachos were really good (make sure to add steak or chicken, both are great), and they give you a lotta guac too. The 7 layer dip was kinda dull, like they scooped out the filling of a microwaved bean and cheese burrito. Either way, all their food is pretty cheap, and during happy hour, drinks are a great deal. Also, I like the way the place is set up; most of it is outdoors/patio, so it makes for a different experience. There's also a lot of games and things to do. We saw a group of guys playing beer pong on one of the tables, and by the women's restroom there's a lobster catching game. We'd spent like 12 bucks on that game and didn't win ourselves a lobster but we got close one time, and it was pretty damn fun.

GWRNmt68B2pA1MgV3-b5XQ.text: In a word: forgettable. This is AZ, you can get better mexican fare on any corner. Largely bland and uncreative, food was just ok. Service was good, food was more than it was worth.

_aEvMHe_fWUqz00w0TbLBw.text: ok, on those nights that you really don't feel like going downtown, but still wanna go somewhere to chill with friends, this place is PERFECT!  whats not to love about the sweet margs, cheap beer, and awesome happy hour specials!   the chicken dip is absolutely amazing!   We used to come here for dinner once a week also, but since they took the stuffed poblano off them menu, we really only come for drinks and apps.  the employees are so much fun and the whole atmosphere just makes you forget your stress.. or was it all those delicious strawberry margs?...   hmm :)

4onrYCA1bCHGjMSurBARXg.text: Dos Gringos always reminds me of good times.  Specially the one on Alma School and Knox.. Good times, good friends, 2 many wild things.. woohooo!!!

OQQqMErWT3mZVOwrss5x4A.text: I am a big advocate of Dos Gringos actually but this Dos I cannot get into.  I loved the original Tempe location when it was on University, I used to go there all the time.  I love the Scottsdale location, but ever since they built this location a few years back, it's kind of like a pushover for me.  Yeah they serve the same booze, and food, and the decor is the same, but the vibe of this place isn't right.  Maybe because it's too big and they let too many riff raff's in, I really can't put my hand on it.  The only thing that really saves this place is the .50 cent coronas and well drinks on Thursday nights.  Shit I'm not even sure if they still do that anymore since it has been at least 8 months since I have been there and I don't feel as though I am missing out on anything.  I would never make plans to go here but if I was invited to go out there with a group of friends, I would just have to suck and up and go.

96rR3w8t5dxc6bzCg4LxIQ.text: Ok. We've lived by Dos Gringos off Priest for years. It's been a long time since we've been here for drinks or for food. My husband and I have always said that we remember their food has always been pretty decent. So we got this mailer for a BOGO and it's under new ownership so we went to try it again yesterday. The place is pretty sparse at 530pm so happy hour isn't exactly rocking here (they need better drink specials I think) but that was ok with us because we were just there really for dinner and I'm totally good with a less crowded place and no kids. Anyway, service was EXCELLENT! Our server was so attentive and super sweet. Even the bar tender passed by and asked how things were and if we needed anything (we were sitting inside). Our food came out relatively fast (it was fresh!!) and it was DELISH! Didn't disappoint. We both had a wet burrito with red sauce. I had mine with carne asada and he had his with carnitas. The burritos were big in size. Very very very filling and a good portion of meat. The tortillas were nice and fresh and they were so flavorful. We were really pleased with our meals. I initially went wanting a chicken quesadilla...disappointing to see it wasn't on their menu but happy because I tried something new. So kudos to the new management. Great food and great service! We'll definitely be back and we'll bring some friends!   If you rated this anything below 4 starts maybe try it again. Hopefully you'll have the same experience we had.  Hoping the new management will make changes to their happy hour pricing to help draw a crowd.

photos.caption: Photo of Dos Gringos - Tempe, AZ, United States. Wet burrito with red sauce and steak

zmsHuOaC6ZtJy1UJR4Mgyw.text: I came here on my lunch with classmates so they could eat and I we could celebrate. I'm on a strict diet and can't eat out, so I brought the lunch I prepared. The bartender not even our waitress, came over and aggressively told me I couldn't eat my lunch there after I ordered a drink to compensate for not eating at their establishment. No where was it posted that you couldn't bring in outside food, so I said I was gonna just leave and not pay for the drink I had one sip of. He threatened to call the police because of that. My classmates and I went there to celebrate our last week of school and he made our whole experience so terribly uncomfortable. It could've been handled much differently but not surprised it wasn't.  Thank you, John. When I was told I couldn't bring in outside food, you did not introduce yourself as the GM or even someone that worked there- nor did you speak to me with professionalism and respect that you are now. I appreciate the response and wish you and your business the best in the future!  Best,  Bryan

cCDYU4k-IjZaSEFOXOkoAQ.text: Took way too long to just get a beer. Like 15 minutes. Wasn't busy. 1 bartender, 1 waitress. Half dozen tables.  Updating feedback based on follow up. Thank you.

2o7UBYDbx-TjsbbNzpltuA.text: I'm guessing the negative ratings are from previous management and menu. This place was so good! Chips and salsa are really good! Had the mini chimichangas (beef and chicken) and they were excellent. Hubby had the chimichanga with steak and he ate every bite! Will definitely return

3S_gO2xSmx0NyPzXiBM2wQ.text: I've been to this location a couple of times --- mostly to have a snack and a cold beer.   We arrived at about 11:30 on a Saturday and the place only had a few patrons. Of course there was plenty of outdoor seating since it was early. We grabbed two seats near the bar and our server appeared quickly. She was efficient and fast. Our order came out quickly (as expected since it wasn't crowded). My husband had a GIANT cheesy chimichanga and I ordered the nachos, expecting a very much smaller version. What I got was a surprise (see photo).   The nachos were pretty good and had black beans,  a light drizzle of sour cream, onions, jalapenos, olives and bits of garlic. The garlic surprised me but I was okay with it. I asked for salsa on the side and poured a bit on top which made them perfect. I ended up taking HALF of the nachos home since the portion was so big.   My only annoyance of the time there was a loud dude at the bar. Yeah, I get it...it's a bar, but gimme a break. There is such a thing as too loud at 11:30AM. Other than that, it was a pretty relaxing hour on the patio with a cold beer in my hand.

photos.caption: Photo of Dos Gringos - Tempe, AZ, United States. Giant nachos. I think I&#39;ll need to take out container!

PxqtGP35PFsOoRA7VE_cnw.text: A cool hang out place but keep in mind if you're not a heat person this may not be the place for you, because it's basically an outside restaurant/bar. They do have misters all throughout; however during the time I visited there were only a few on. Not sure how misters work but if all of them were spraying mist it would be a lot cooler. We also happened to be sitting under one that was leaking instead of spraying the mist so not sure how often the maintenance is done on them.   We only came for drinks, and they have different specials every day. I had a michelada with a corona, and holy guacamole it was delicious and perfectly refreshing for that afternoon. Not many can make them good so I was super impressed! After that I just had a couple Coronas and they came out ice cold which is exactly what we were craving on that hot day. Our waitress was super friendly, attentive, and smiled plenty. We did not eat so I can't say much about the food, but they had a good selection.  They also have an area to play jumbo jenga and another area for corn hole which is perfect for summer activities.

UxkamJ8GVCzF9sMieu9qHA.text: My wife and I went there tonight.  The margaritas were awful ..like drinking straight lime mix without any liquor.  To be fair, the food, service and atmosphere was very good.

Ir12O6rnBrQMCBdmniKVwg.text: My husband and me came to eat during the day. The food was good and the music was perfect. Not too loud. I love the vibe here. Haley was very attentive. Our second time back with the family and got to say im very pleased with the service here. They were able to accomodate my son who is in a wheelchair at a bench outside in the shade. Today was a hot day and the misters were on. My son loved the misters above him. Today we tried other dishes and they were so good. Rochelle was very attentive. John the manager came to ask how the food was and check on us. And that is what i love about customer service. Come check this place out. You wont be displeased. Even just for a beer at the bar. Thank you so much!!!

j2LaJ1VusG2CgyxkBoRiOw.text: We stopped to check out Dos Gringos at the taco festival today. They only had two types of tacos available so we tried the both pork and chicken. I should have known it wasn't the best because there was literally no line compared to every other stand overflowing with people. We received them pretty quick, but they were already cold and did not look very appealing. My husband said his pork taco was ok. The chicken taco was pretty juicy but the hot sauce reminded me of something Taco Bell would sell. I was so bummed.

85bcNO5Tve5LkObOyFcYeQ.text: attentive staff great food... more words because the app doesnt like short reviews

pNWJTynJh-tO4O8aiRxtlg.text: Wow how disappointing this place was very old and dirty looking went with a friend ordered two shredded beef tacos each came with no cheese on top tasteless not to mention over 35 minutes to get them with no one in the place

24ZdulcGawuMyjL9c9EIDQ.text: My second time at Dos Gringos. The first time was on a Tuesday for tacos and drinks. Their tacos are fairly small portions for the price that you pay. Some have more flavored than others but would not be my go to spot for tacos.   Second go around, I got the bean and cheese burrito smothered (a lot of queso, which is a plus) and it was good, not great. They have great drink specials ALL WEEK, which is a plus. I would definitely go back for the drinks but the food I can get else where.   It is a good environment to hangout with friends, watch sports and play games.

GLFHRYJaIt3Wkrw4L3tCLg.text: DO NOT ORDER TAKEOUT. We ordered take out and we ordered chips and queso and they didn't give us any chips. So annoying. Also, their monster tacos taste like cardboard and we will never return to Dos Gringos. Also, the queso wasn't even filled half way up the cup and the salsas have like two spoonfuls. Very frustrating and they ruined our dinner night at home.

z2KAKrQhKaymMWgLUnXdEA.text: There was a lot of people when we came! It was lively and everyone was playing games. I ordered a entree and then salsa and chips for an appetizer. They brought all the food out together, and got our order wrong, BUT the alcohol service was fast. The tacos were flavorful, but the chips were over done and tasted stale. The salsa looks like it almost tipped over in the basket. It was ok but not amazing *edit: despite the kinda crappy service, the tacos were the bomb.com

0ki38c_vrmCkkrhzdQ9lhA.text: I was there today during lunch time and the (I think) bartender who was an African American man and our server (a caucasian younger female) were both really rude.  The drinks were fine, but we left after having our first one because of the terrible attitude and service we received.  I hope that they do some hiring and get a better team working there.  Next time, I will go to Sand Bar...I won't be back.

agPsfBqDYrcIX9hAoPOMHA.text: Food was great but it's under new management, we were charged for refills on teas . Did not know until we received our bill and was charged 12 dollars for 2 teas and refills. Probably want be going back.

8xap-HG3zbl4wbkqdPJKww.text: Eh.   Came here for Taco Tuesday night. They have taco and drink deals on Tuesdays, and other deals almost every other day of the week too.   I ordered crunch tacos, carnitas tacos, and tostadas. Tacos were 2 for $3 and the totadas were $6 for 2? So each taco was about $1.50 which isn't too bad. I just hated that I couldn't order just one since I love taste testing everything. If I could have I would have ordered one of each. The tacos were small, not really full of meat. Crunchy tacos were eh - definitely needed more flavor. The carnitas were BOMB, but so small! After 4 tacos, I was STILL hungry. So I ordered the tostadas. Man, those were big. Beans, meat, cheese, veggies. I ate one and I was out. I probably should have just ordered the tostadas and be done.   It was seat yourself type seating. And even though we were seated by a server, our service was still SO SLOW. No drinks, no orders taken, took forever to flag someone down for the bill. I wasn't in a hurry or anything, but its just frustrating when there is NO ONE to be found and isn't not even busy in the restaurant.   Environment: 3/5 Food: 2.5/5 Price: 4/5 - only for taco tuesday deals Service: 1/5
